basics.name: Roza Gunes Bayrak
basics.label: Early Career Researcher
basics.summary: A Turkish-born computational neuroimaging researcher, with a passion in open and inclusive science.

work.name: Computer Science, Vanderbilt University
work.summary: I navigate the vast landscapes of neuroimaging, crafting methodologies where the intellectual terra incognita begins.

volunteer.summary: Established the first hub in the US.
Lead organizer of the inaugural multi-department gathering for inter-disciplinary brain research.

volunteer.organization: Open Science Room (at the OHBM Annual Meeting)
volunteer.summary: Addressed new and emerging topics, fields and concerns, along with big picture issues in Open Science. Created virtual working group and interaction spaces, supported attendees in making real connections.
Established many new practices and amplified the existing ones, including creativity-through-art and research accountability groups, and coffee talks with Women in Science.

education.area: Thesis: Computational Methods to Advance Individual Precision in Brain Mapping
